main event: Four bright bluish-white lights were seen flaming over Islip, Long Island, New York, and then moving toward an easterly direction at high speed before disappearing.
interesting points: Interceptor pilots reported seeing the Aurora Borealis in the area of the reported sighting.
The Air Defense Sector was experiencing some radar jamming at various sites during the incident.
Two F-101A aircraft were scrambled to the area but could not locate any target, only the
It was determined that a weather balloon was launched from Idlewild Airport around the time of the sighting.
result: Probable cause was that the observed Aurora Borealis was mistaken by the observers as a manmade weather balloon which drifted away before the interceptors could reach the area.
